intro: Notopterygium forrestii, commonly known as the Chinese angelica or mountain angelica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers. Its roots are valued in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported medicinal properties. Notopterygium forrestii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations.
